TopicTitle: What does the command module item in the staging mean?

Articles.Content:
This may be a little bit of a noobish question, but I'm wondering what the command capsule in the staging area is for. I've been mostly just ignoring it until now.

Edited December 7, 2013 by WhiteRaven22
Pretty sure it is not for anything, just was unintentionally added back in the last update, expected to be removed in the next.
Iv'e been wondering about that too, it does not seem to effect anything no matter where you place it in the staging ! So whats it for ?

Probably just a placeholder. The staging automatically arranges itself based on each part's location in the "tree" as well as its physical location - parts closer to the command part are considered "higher" in the staging, so the capsule gives you a rough idea of where other staged parts are in relation to it.

Until you start dragging things around, that is.

=Smidge=

its a dev remanant, it happens to appear in the release from time to time.

It can also show how much force your SAS has to exert (thus, power to waste) to steer your giga-heavy-wieght craft.
You're all wrong. It's a newly added feature. The command pod will execute a crew report when it is staged without popping the window up.
